text: (upbeat music)
(typing)
(upbeat music)

- Hello, I'm Pranay, a
Cloud Support Engineer here
at AWS office in Bangalore, India.
Today, I'll show you how

to download Binary Logs
from an RDS MySQL Instance.
Let's get started.

MySQL has mysqlbinlog utility
to process binary logs.
This utility reads binary log files
and displays their content in text format.
The following is the sample command

to download a particular binary
log to your local machine.

If your binary log format is
ROW, please add verbose option

in the below command to see
the row events as comments
in the form of "pseudo-SQL" statements.
For this demonstration,

I've already logged into
Amazon Linux Telnet.
I have access to RDS MySQL 5.6 Instance
where I want to download binary logs from.
First, I'll install MySQL command line
by running the following command.
Log in into RDS MySQL Instance.
Now, next then show binary logs to list

the binary logs present
on the database server.
I have to make note of binary log name

that I want to download and
log it from the database.

In this case, I'll
download the first file.

Now I'll run the fall line
command to get the binary log.
This saves the binary log
in the text format on local machine.
If your binary log format is ROW,

please add verbose option
to MySQL bin log command.

In my environment I'm using
bin log format as mixed,
which is default value for RDS MySQL.

Note that the database
user used in this operation
should have replications layer privilege.
The file download was completed.
Let's check the downloaded log.
Let's open the log and check the contents.

Congratulations, you now know
how to successfully download
binary logs from RDS MySQL instance.

Thanks for watching and
happy cloud computing
from all of us here at AWS.
(upbeat music)
